question: Manual image segmentation is a necessary feature for a manual labeling tool.
Drawing of bounding boxes is a necessary requirement of a manual labeling tool
Other labels such as lines, multi-segment lines and circles are a necessary requirement for a manual labeling tool
3d labels should be supported
The labeling process should be simple, fast, and intuitive
Management of metadata is a necessary requirement of a labeling tool
support for for different color spaces is a necessary requirement of a labeling tool
Collaboration is a necessary requirement of a labeling tool
sharing with other teams is a necessary requirement of a labeling tool
Good management of datasets (good overview/ tags / sorting) is a necessary requirement of a labeling tool
support for https://dvc.org/ is required
Verification of labeled data is a necessary requirement of a labeling tool
import of automatically generated or existing labels is a necessary requirement of a labeling tool
The image annotation tool should be a hosted web app
automatic labeling should be done in the cloud
a fast switch between verification and editing of annotations is required
false positives and false negatives should be specially highlighted to allow a feedback loop for automatic labeling
the annotation tool should (if hosted online) support an API or webhooks
Uploading or generation of synthetic data is required
comment: threre was some confusion about this question

question: stereo images should be supported
annotations should be exportable in various formats
datasets should be versioned
synchronization with a git repository of label data should be possible
labeling jobs (specifying who, which images, which labels) should exist
who labeled and who verified (reviewed) should be displayed
relabeling previously generated data should be supported
merging of labels of different classification systems should be supported
conversion between annotation types (segmentation -> bounding box, bounding_box-> circle) should be possible
